title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
20v without battery 
PPBUS 13v is present 
3v3_g3h is present 
All voltages around cd is present 
[B]It will show this error and flash apple logo and goes back to dfu. [/B]

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

Do you get all SSD voltages?
Any fault history available?

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
I’ll check for ssd voltages
Faults. Yes
The macbook came in with 5v, I changed  one resistor around u7000 and 20v came. The Macbook  trackpad is clicking but no apple logo, black screen. 
I now try to restore it with configurator 2. 
then this error 9 came.It’s permanently on dfu now.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
PP2v5_nand_SSD0 is present
PP1v8_SSD0 is present
PP0v9_SSD0 is present
20v 0.05a going back and forth to 0.00a on the ampmeter

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Can you put the machine in boot menu?
Does it stay on then, or still restarts?

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: You mean I should press the option key

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Exactly, maintain pressed and wait; no need to press power button.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Nothing happened still no apple logo. But the track pad clicks for a while and stop and start again and stop

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: I have three MacBooks same issue. Pls help

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Trackpad click is not a sign of life.
Once actuator is powered, you will sense the force feedback.
But is just a hardaware response, no need the board to boot.

Check if board voltages are steady, or restarts at the moment when trackpad click is not present.

Do you have 3 identical boards, with exact the same symptoms?

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Around the usb c controller ic u3200
Pp3v3_upc_xb_ldo is steady 
Pp3v3_g3h_rtc_x is steady
Ppbus_g3h is steady
Pp1v8_slps2r is steady
5v is missing though 
Voltages are steady. The once I have checked so far. 
yes 3 different board drawing 20v no life.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: The amp meter reads 20v and 0.06  0.067 0,05

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
If you get 20V on all USB-C ports (without battery), then no problem on USB-C areas.

Do you have 820-01814 boards?
For the future, please post board model on the title, or first post.

Did you try both revive and restore options in DFU?
Revive doesn't erase the SSD.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Yes. It gives me error 9. The macbook will flash apple logo with a progress bar. With error 9
It’s 802-01814-01

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
If you get Apple logo and progress bar, SSD is initialized at least.
This doesn't discard an internal problem; maybe some bad NAND.

Can you get access to it in Target Disk mode?

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: How do I get to disk mode pls

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/how-to-collection.60974/[/URL]
No need to press power button for this machine.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: I press the  T key. Nothing happened.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Can it be the T2 chip or bios

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
BIOS is not accessible anymore; is embedded into T2 chip.
Very likely T2 internal problem...

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: So what can I do pls

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Should I change the t2 chip

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Can it be a incompatible u7000 because I took it from a donor board that is 2019

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
U7000 is good, as the board boots.
We have few threads about changing T2, but nobody left a feedback if tried and result got.
Keep in mind, some information is baked into T2 and can't be copied.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
The board is not booting, I just have only 20v on the type c ammeter
Ssd voltages ok
3v ok
No s4 rails
Pls what’s else can I check or have we concluded it’s the T2

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
"The macbook will flash apple logo with a progress bar"
How is this possible, if the board doesn't boot?

Getting 13V at PPBUS_G3H, even for non botting board, means U7000 is OK.

If DFU can't be completed, looks like T2 problem...

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: So what should I do. Any information on how to change T2. Cause I have a lot of them here. And I’ll be glad to fix them. Thanks

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
As I said, nobody left feedback about changing T2.
If you have time, replace with one from donor board, same model; then try DFU.
At the end, may be just waste of time...

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
If you get an Apple logo with a progress bar, the NANDs and T2 are basically working. This is very suspect for an issue within the enclosure. Inspect trackpad and keyboard connector area for signs of damage. Or better yet, try in a known working enclosure. 

I suspect you have something totally different going on. Why did you put the machine into DFU mode? From what you posted, it does not seem like it was in DFU by default.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
The machine was drawing 5v initially, I changed u 7000. It stated drawing 20v. But still black screen no boot. So I thought of trying to restore it with configurator 2. So that how I got to dfu mode. 
check all ssd voltages are all available. 
configurator 2 gave me error 9. There was a flash of an apple logo on the screen then error 9.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: The apple logo didn’t stay. Just a flash of an apple logo on the screen.  Then error 9.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
OK, 

As I suspected. We had a totally different issue, Now we have a secondary issue. What version OS is the machine you are using to restore using? 

Did you note any amperage before putting it in DFU? 

Why was U7000 changed? What was missing? Was anything measured or was it just empirically replaced?

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: I can’t  remember vividly, but I changed one of the resistor beside the u7000. The resistor was physically damaged( small hole in the middle of the resistor) and 20v came. No display, track pad feedback intermittently( the track pad feed back goes off and on. Every 5sec the track back will click and stops intermittently , now configurator 2, dfu, error9. Thats the sequence.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Do you mean PPBUS_G3H cycles every 5s?
That explains why DFU isn't completed.

Try starting in SMC bypass mode.
Let see if the problem is not caused by some power sensor.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: Tired smc  bypass mode process twice. Nothing happened

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
I have another A1990 too doing the same thing. It just came in now. 20v 0.0a going up to 0.08 0.056 0.079 0.089 then 1.03 then back to 0.80 then 0.00a.
Non of the ssd voltages is available
They are all reading milli voltages
2v5_nand_ssd0 is shorted to Ground
I cleared the shot.. but is not still coming up. With battery it’s drawing up to 3.15a
But without battery it’s drawing. 0.00,.0.05,0.07 back to 0.00
Pls what can I do
ppbus_g3h Is present

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Please open new thread with this board; is not the same symptom.

You didn't specify if PPBUS_G3H is stable, or cycling every 5s, on the actual board.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: PPBUS is stable, I held on it more that 5 sec.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Do you have the same behavior with flashing Apple logo now?

Be sure all AWAKE and SLPS2R voltages are steady; not cycling after 5s.
Check the same for SSD voltages.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 86302, member: 682"]

Check the same for SSD voltages.
[/QUOTE]

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
I saw similar symptom solved with DFU restore.
The strange thing is that you can't complete DFU.
This make me suspect T2 internal problem.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message: error 9 is related to the power supply of the ssd or the bad ssd. Very common in that model.

pls what can I do again.

title: A1990 AmrestoreErrorDomin Error-9 trying to restore with configurator 2
message:
Unfortunatelly not all is repairable.
And Apple has a lot of success with latest machines; almost not repairable...
